    134addHooks = (runner, transactions, callback) ->
    14 # Note: runner.configuration.options must be defined
    15
    16104 fixLegacyTransactionNames = (allHooks) ->
    1715 pattern = /^\s>\s/g
    1815 for hookType in ['beforeHooks', 'afterHooks']
    1930 for transactionName, hooks of allHooks[hookType]
    2024 if transactionName.match(pattern) != null
    219 newTransactionName = transactionName.replace(pattern, '')
    229 if allHooks[hookType][newTransactionName] != undefined
    231 allHooks[hookType][newTransactionName] = hooks.concat allHooks[hookType][newTransactionName]
    24 else
    258 allHooks[hookType][newTransactionName] = hooks
    26
    279 delete allHooks[hookType][transactionName]
    28
    29104 runner.logs ?= []
    30104 runner.hooks = new Hooks(logs: runner.logs, logger: logger)
    31104 runner.hooks.transactions ?= {}
    32
    33104 customConfigCwd = runner?.configuration?.custom?.cwd
    34
    35104 for transaction in transactions
    3680 runner.hooks.transactions[transaction.name] = transaction
    37
    38104 pattern = runner?.configuration?.options?.hookfiles
    39104 if not pattern
    4093 if runner.configuration.hooksData?
    418 if runner.configuration.options.sandbox == true
    427 if typeof(runner.configuration.hooksData) != 'object' or Array.isArray(runner.configuration.hooksData) != false
    430 return callback(new Error("hooksData option must be an object e.g. {'filename.js':'console.log(\"Hey!\")'}"))
    44
    45 # run code in sandbox
    467 async.eachSeries Object.keys(runner.configuration.hooksData), (key, nextHook) ->
    477 data = runner.configuration.hooksData[key]
    48
    49 # run code in sandbox
    507 sandboxHooksCode data, (sandboxError, result) ->
    517 return nextHook(sandboxError) if sandboxError
    52
    53 # merge stringified hooks
    547 runner.hooks = mergeSandboxedHooks(runner.hooks, result)
    55
    56 # Fixing #168 issue
    577 fixLegacyTransactionNames runner.hooks
    58
    597 nextHook()
    60
    61 , callback
    62 else
    631 msg = """
    64 Not sandboxed hooks loading from strings is not implemented,
    65 Sandbox mode must be enabled when loading hooks from strings."
    66 """
    671 callback(new Error(msg))
    68 else
    6985 return callback()
    70 else
    7111 patternArray = [].concat pattern
    72
    7311 async.eachSeries patternArray, (item, nextPattern) ->
    7411 files = glob.sync item
    75
    7611 logger.info 'Found Hookfiles: ' + files
    77
    78 # Running in not sandboxed mode
    7911 if not runner.configuration.options.sandbox == true
    806 try
    816 for file in files
    8211 proxyquire path.resolve((customConfigCwd or process.cwd()), file), {
    83 'hooks': runner.hooks
    84 }
    85
    86 # Fixing #168 issue
    873 fixLegacyTransactionNames runner.hooks
    883 return nextPattern()
    89 catch error
    903 logger.warn 'Skipping hook loading...'
    913 logger.warn 'Error reading hook files (' + files + ')'
    923 logger.warn 'This probably means one or more of your hookfiles is invalid.'
    933 logger.warn 'Message: ' + error.message if error.message?
    943 logger.warn 'Stack: ' + error.stack if error.stack?
    953 return nextPattern()
    96
    97 # Running in sandboxed mode
    98 else
    995 logger.info 'Loading hookfiles in sandboxed context: ' + files
    1005 async.eachSeries files, (fileName, nextFile) ->
    1015 resolvedPath = path.resolve((customConfigCwd or process.cwd()), fileName)
    102
    103 # load hook file content
    1045 fs.readFile resolvedPath, 'utf8', (readingError, data) ->
    1055 return nextFile(readingError) if readingError
    106
    107 # run code in sandbox
    1085 sandboxHooksCode data, (sandboxError, result) ->
    1095 return nextFile(sandboxError) if sandboxError
    110
    1115 runner.hooks = mergeSandboxedHooks(runner.hooks, result)
    112
    113 # Fixing #168 issue
    1145 fixLegacyTransactionNames runner.hooks
    115
    1165 nextFile()
    117 , nextPattern
    118 , callback
    119

    81blueprintAstToRuntime = (blueprintAst, filename) ->

    121blueprintUtils.sortNumbersAscending = (a, b) ->
    13110 return a - b

    151blueprintUtils.warningLocationToRanges = (warningLocation = [], text = '') ->
    1636 unless warningLocation.length
    17 # no start-end ranges, nothing to return
    182 return []
    19
    2034 rowsIndexes = []
    21
    2234 position = blueprintUtils.characterIndexToPosition(warningLocation[0].index, text)
    23
    24 # add this warning position row into ranges array
    2534 rowsIndexes.push position.row
    26
    2734 lastLocation = warningLocation[warningLocation.length - 1]
    28
    2934 if warningLocation.length > 0
    30 # more lines
    3134 for loc, locKey in warningLocation when locKey > 0
    32110 position = blueprintUtils.characterIndexToPosition(loc.index, text)
    33110 rowsIndexes.push position.row
    34
    3534 rowsIndexes.sort(blueprintUtils.sortNumbersAscending)
    3634 ranges = []
    3734 range = {start: rowsIndexes[0], end: rowsIndexes[0]}
    3834 for rowIndex in rowsIndexes
    39144 if rowIndex is range.end or rowIndex is range.end + 1 # moving end of known range
    40142 range.end = rowIndex
    41 else
    422 ranges.push range # non-continuous range
    432 range = {start: rowIndex, end: rowIndex}
    44 # push the last edited range to ranges-array
    4534 ranges.push range
    4634 return ranges
    47
    48

    133 loadDreddFile: () ->
    13411 if fs.existsSync './dredd.yml'
    1351 console.log 'Configuration dredd.yml found, ignoring other arguments.'
    1361 @argv = configUtils.load()
    137
    138 # overwrite saved config with cli arguments
    13911 for key, value of @cliArgv
    14027 if key != "_" and key != "$0"
    1415 @argv[key] = value
    142
    143
    144 parseCustomConfig: () ->
    14514 @argv.custom = configUtils.parseCustom @argv.custom
    146
    147 runServerAndThenDredd: (callback) ->
    1489 if not @argv['server']?
    1499 @runDredd @dreddInstance
    150 else
    1510 @serverProcess = exec @argv['server']
    1520 console.log "Starting server with command: #{@argv['server']}"
    153
    1540 @serverProcess.stdout.setEncoding 'utf8'
    155
    1560 @serverProcess.stdout.on 'data', (data) ->
    1570 process.stdout.write data.toString()
    158
    1590 @serverProcess.stderr.setEncoding 'utf8'
    160
    1610 @serverProcess.stderr.on 'data', (data) ->
    1620 process.stdout.write data.toString()
    163
    1640 @serverProcess.on 'error', (error) =>
    1650 console.log error
    1660 console.log "Server command failed, exitting..."
    1670 @_processExit(2)
    168
    1690 waitSecs = parseInt(@argv['server-wait'], 10)
    1700 waitMilis = waitSecs * 1000
    1710 console.log "Waiting #{waitSecs} seconds for server command to start..."
    172
    1730 @wait = setTimeout =>
    1740 @runDredd @dreddInstance
    175 , waitMilis
    176
    177 run: ->
    17814 for task in [
    179 @setOptimistArgv
    180 @setExitOrCallback
    181 @parseCustomConfig
    182 @runExitingActions
    183 @loadDreddFile
    184 @checkRequiredArgs
    185 @moveBlueprintArgToPath
    186 ]
    18787 task.call @
    18887 return if @finished
    189
    1909 configurationForDredd = @initConfig()
    1919 @dreddInstance = @initDredd configurationForDredd
    192
    1939 try
    1949 @runServerAndThenDredd()
    195 catch e
    1960 console.log e.message
    1970 console.log e.stack
    1980 @_processExit(2)
    199
    2009 return
    201
    202
    203 lastArgvIsApiEndpoint: ->
    204 # when blueprint path is a glob, some shells are automatically expanding globs and concating
    205 # result as arguments so I'm taking last argument as API endpoint server URL and removing it
    206 # forom optimist's args
    2079 @server = @argv._[@argv._.length - 1]
    2089 @argv._.splice(@argv._.length - 1, 1)
    2099 return @
    210
    211 takeRestOfParamsAsPath: ->
    212 # and rest of arguments concating to 'path' and 'p' opts, duplicates are filtered out later
    2139 @argv['p'] = @argv['path'] = @argv['path'].concat(@argv._)
    2149 return @
    215
    216 initConfig: ->
    2179 @
    218 .lastArgvIsApiEndpoint()
    219 .takeRestOfParamsAsPath()
    220
    2219 configuration =
    222 'server': @server
    223 'options': @argv
    224
    225 # push first argument (without some known configuration --key) into paths
    2269 configuration.options.path ?= []
    2279 configuration.options.path.push @argv._[0]
    228
    2299 configuration.custom = @custom
    230
    2319 return configuration
    232
    233 initDredd: (configuration) ->
    2348 dredd = new Dredd configuration
    2358 return dredd
    236
    237 commandSigInt: ->
    2380 console.log "\nShutting down from SIGINT (Ctrl-C)"
    2390 @dreddInstance.transactionsComplete => @_processExit(0)
    240
    241 runDredd: (dreddInstance) ->
    2429 if @sigIntEventAdd
    243 # handle SIGINT from user
    2440 @sigIntEventAdded = !@sigIntEventAdd = false
    2450 process.on 'SIGINT', @commandSigInt
    246
    2479 dreddInstance.run (error, stats) =>
    2488 if error
    2492 if error.message
    2502 console.error error.message
    2512 if error.stack
    2520 console.error error.stack
    2532 return @_processExit(1)
    254
    2556 if (stats.failures + stats.errors) > 0
    2562 @_processExit(1)
    257 else
    2584 @_processExit(0)
    2596 return
    260
    2619 return @
    262

    224removeDuplicates = (arr) ->

    24203 if alreadyProcessed.indexOf(currentItem) is -1
    25149 return alreadyProcessed.concat currentItem

    294class Dredd
    30 constructor: (config) ->
    3145 @init(config)
    32
    33 # this is here only because there there is no way how to spy a constructor in CoffeScript
    34 init: (config) ->
    3545 @tests = []
    3645 @stats =
    37 tests: 0
    38 failures: 0
    39 errors: 0
    40 passes: 0
    41 skipped: 0
    42 start: 0
    43 end: 0
    44 duration: 0
    45
    4645 @configuration = applyConfiguration(config, @stats)
    4745 @configuration.options ?= {}
    48
    4945 @runner = new Runner @configuration
    5045 configureReporters @configuration, @stats, @tests, @runner
    51
    52 run: (callback) ->
    5352 config = @configuration
    5452 stats = @stats
    55
    5652 configDataIsEmpty = true
    57
    5852 config.files ?= []
    5952 config.data ?= {}
    6052 runtimes = {}
    61
    6252 passedConfigData = {}
    63
    6452 for own key, val of config.data or {}
    6549 configDataIsEmpty = false
    6649 if (typeof val is 'string')
    674 passedConfigData[key] = {
    68 filename: key
    69 raw: val
    70 }
    7145 else if (typeof val is 'object') and val.raw and val.filename
    7245 passedConfigData[val.filename] = {
    73 filename: val.filename
    74 raw: val.raw
    75 }
    76
    7752 if not configDataIsEmpty
    7815 config.data = passedConfigData
    79
    80 # remove duplicate paths
    8152 config.options.path = removeDuplicates config.options.path
    82
    83 # expand all globs
    8452 expandGlobs = (cb) ->
    8552 async.each config.options.path, (globToExpand, globCallback) ->
    8667 if /^http(s)?:\/\//.test globToExpand
    8720 config.files = config.files.concat globToExpand
    8820 return globCallback()
    8947 glob globToExpand, (err, match) ->
    9047 globCallback err if err
    9147 config.files = config.files.concat match
    9247 globCallback()
    93
    94 , (err) ->
    9552 return callback(err, stats) if err
    96
    9752 if configDataIsEmpty and config.files.length == 0
    983 return callback({message: "Blueprint file or files not found on path: '#{config.options.path}'"}, stats)
    99
    100 # remove duplicate filenames
    10149 config.files = removeDuplicates config.files
    10249 cb()
    103
    104 # load all files
    10552 loadFiles = (cb) ->
    106 # 6 parallel connections is a standard limit when connecting to one hostname,
    107 # use the same limit of parallel connections for reading/downloading files
    10849 async.eachLimit config.files, 6, (fileUrlOrPath, loadCallback) ->
    10982 try
    11082 fileUrl = url.parse fileUrlOrPath
    111 catch
    1120 fileUrl = null
    113
    11482 if fileUrl and fileUrl.protocol in ['http:', 'https:'] and fileUrl.host
    11520 downloadFile fileUrlOrPath, loadCallback
    116 else
    11762 readLocalFile fileUrlOrPath, loadCallback
    118
    119 , (err) ->
    12049 return callback(err, stats) if err
    12141 cb()
    122
    12352 downloadFile = (fileUrl, downloadCallback) ->
    12420 request.get
    125 url: fileUrl
    126 timeout: 5000
    127 json: false
    128 , (downloadError, res, body) ->
    12920 if downloadError
    1304 downloadCallback {
    1314 message: "Error when loading file from URL '#{fileUrl}'. Is the provided URL correct?"
    132 }
    13316 else if not body or res.statusCode < 200 or res.statusCode >= 300
    1344 downloadCallback {
    1354 message: """
    1364 Unable to load file from URL '#{fileUrl}'. \
    1374 Server did not send any blueprint back and responded with status code #{res.statusCode}.
    138 """
    139 }
    140 else
    14112 config.data[fileUrl] = {raw: body, filename: fileUrl}
    14212 downloadCallback()
    143
    14452 readLocalFile = (filePath, readCallback) ->
    14562 fs.readFile filePath, 'utf8', (readingError, data) ->
    14662 return readCallback(readingError) if readingError
    14762 config.data[filePath] = {raw: data, filename: filePath}
    14862 readCallback()
    149
    150 # parse all file blueprints
    15152 parseBlueprints = (cb) ->
    15241 async.each Object.keys(config.data), (file, parseCallback) ->
    15366 drafter = new Drafter
    15466 drafter.make config.data[file]['raw'], (drafterError, result) ->
    15566 return parseCallback drafterError if drafterError
    15664 config.data[file]['parsed'] = result
    15764 parseCallback()
    158 , (err) ->
    15941 return callback(err, config.reporter) if err
    160 # log all parser warnings for each ast
    16139 for file, data of config.data
    16264 result = data['parsed']
    16364 if result['warnings'].length > 0
    16428 for warning in result['warnings']
    16528 message = "Parser warning in file '#{file}':" + ' (' + warning.code + ') ' + warning.message
    16628 ranges = blueprintUtils.warningLocationToRanges warning['location'], data['raw']
    16728 if ranges?.length
    16828 pos = blueprintUtils.rangesToLinesText ranges
    16928 message = message + ' on ' + pos
    17028 logger.warn message
    171
    172
    17339 runtimes['warnings'] = []
    17439 runtimes['errors'] = []
    17539 runtimes['transactions'] = []
    176
    177 # extract http transactions for each ast
    17839 for file, data of config.data
    17964 runtime = blueprintAstToRuntime data['parsed']['ast'], file
    180
    18164 runtimes['warnings'] = runtimes['warnings'].concat(runtime['warnings'])
    18264 runtimes['errors'] = runtimes['errors'].concat(runtime['errors'])
    18364 runtimes['transactions'] = runtimes['transactions'].concat(runtime['transactions'])
    184
    18539 runtimeError = handleRuntimeProblems runtimes
    18639 return callback(runtimeError, stats) if runtimeError
    18737 cb()
    188
    189 #start the runner
    19052 startRunner = =>
    19137 reporterCount = config.emitter.listeners('start').length
    19237 config.emitter.emit 'start', config.data, =>
    19354 reporterCount--
    19454 if reporterCount is 0
    195
    196 # run all transactions
    19737 @runner.config(config)
    19837 @runner.run runtimes['transactions'], =>
    19937 @transactionsComplete(callback)
    200
    201 # spin that merry-go-round
    20252 expandGlobs ->
    20349 loadFiles ->
    20441 parseBlueprints ->
    20537 startRunner()
    206
    207
    208
    209 transactionsComplete: (callback) =>
    21037 stats = @stats
    21137 reporterCount = @configuration.emitter.listeners('end').length
    21237 @configuration.emitter.emit 'end', ->
    21354 reporterCount--
    21454 if reporterCount is 0
    21537 callback(null, stats)
    216
    2174module.exports = Dredd
    2184module.exports.options = options

    31expandUriTemplateWithParameters = (uriTemplate, parameters) ->
    4143 result =
    5 errors: []
    6 warnings: []
    7 uri: null
    8143 try
    9143 parsed = ut.parse uriTemplate
    10 catch e
    1113 text = "\n Failed to parse URI template: #{uriTemplate}"
    1213 text += "\n Error: #{e}"
    1313 result['errors'].push text
    1413 return result
    15
    16 # get parameters from expression object
    17130 uriParameters = []
    18130 for expression in parsed['expressions']
    1960 for param in expression['params']
    2060 uriParameters.push param['name']
    21
    22 # check if all parameters from blueprint have an expression in URI
    23130 for parameter in Object.keys(parameters)
    2455 if uriParameters.indexOf(parameter) == -1
    253 text = "\nURI template: #{uriTemplate}\nDoesn\'t contain expression for parameter" + \
    26 " '" + parameter + "'"
    273 result['warnings'].push text
    28
    29130 if parsed['expressions'].length == 0
    3070 result['uri'] = uriTemplate
    31 else
    3260 ambigous = false
    33
    3460 for uriParameter in uriParameters
    3560 if Object.keys(parameters).indexOf(uriParameter) == -1
    368 ambigous = true
    378 text = "\nAmbigous URI parameter in template: #{uriTemplate} " + \
    38 "\nParameter not defined in blueprint:" + \
    39 "'" + uriParameter + "'"
    408 result['warnings'].push text
    41
    4260 if ambigous == false
    4352 toExpand = {}
    4452 for uriParameter in uriParameters
    4552 param = parameters[uriParameter]
    4652 if param['required'] == true
    4748 if param['example'] == undefined or param['example'] == ""
    481 ambigous = true
    491 text = "\nAmbigous URI parameter in template: #{uriTemplate} " + \
    50 "\nNo example value for required parameter in blueprint:" + \
    51 "'" + uriParameter + "'"
    521 result['warnings'].push text
    53 else
    5447 toExpand[uriParameter] = param['example']
    55 else
    564 if param['example'] != undefined and param['example'] != ""
    572 toExpand[uriParameter] = param['example']
    582 else if param['default'] != undefined and param['default'] != ""
    591 toExpand[uriParameter] = param['default']
    60
    6160 if ambigous == false
    6251 result['uri'] = parsed.expand toExpand
    63
    64130 return result

    3# READ THIS! Disclaimer:
    4# Do not add any functionality to this class unless you want to expose it to the Hooks API.
    5# This class is only an interface for users of Dredd hooks.
    6
    71class Hooks
    8 constructor: (options = {}) ->
    9175 {@logs, @logger} = options
    10175 @transactions = {}
    11175 @beforeHooks = {}
    12175 @beforeValidationHooks = {}
    13175 @afterHooks = {}
    14175 @beforeAllHooks = []
    15175 @afterAllHooks = []
    16175 @beforeEachHooks = []
    17175 @beforeEachValidationHooks = []
    18175 @afterEachHooks = []
    19
    20 before: (name, hook) =>
    2133 @addHook(@beforeHooks, name, hook)
    22
    23 beforeValidation: (name, hook) =>
    241 @addHook(@beforeValidationHooks, name, hook)
    25
    26 after: (name, hook) =>
    2739 @addHook(@afterHooks, name, hook)
    28
    29 beforeAll: (hook) =>
    3045 @beforeAllHooks.push hook
    31
    32 afterAll: (hook) =>
    3338 @afterAllHooks.push hook
    34
    35 beforeEach: (hook) =>
    3631 @beforeEachHooks.push hook
    37
    38 beforeEachValidation: (hook) =>
    394 @beforeEachValidationHooks.push hook
    40
    41 afterEach: (hook) =>
    4231 @afterEachHooks.push hook
    43
    44 addHook: (hooks, name, hook) ->
    4573 if hooks[name]
    465 hooks[name].push hook
    47 else
    4868 hooks[name] = [hook]
    49
    50 # log(logVariant, content)
    51 # log(content)
    52 log: (args...) =>
    531 @logs = hooksLog @logs, @logger, args...
    541 return
    55
    56 # This is not part of hooks API
    57 # This is here only because it has to be injected into sandboxed context
    58 dumpHooksFunctionsToStrings: =>
    59 # prepare JSON friendly object
    6028 toReturn = {}
    6128 names = [
    62 'beforeHooks'
    63 'beforeValidationHooks'
    64 'afterHooks'
    65 'beforeAllHooks'
    66 'afterAllHooks'
    67 'beforeEachHooks'
    68 'beforeEachValidationHooks'
    69 'afterEachHooks'
    70 ]
    71
    7228 for property in names
    73224 if Array.isArray @[property]
    74140 toReturn[property] = []
    75140 for index, hookFunc of @[property]
    76112 toReturn[property][index] = hookFunc.toString()
    77
    7884 else if typeof(@[property]) is 'object' and not Array.isArray(@[property])
    7984 toReturn[property] = {}
    8084 for transactionName, funcArray of @[property] when funcArray.length
    8156 toReturn[property][transactionName] = []
    8256 for index, hookFunc of funcArray
    8356 toReturn[property][transactionName][index] = hookFunc.toString()
    84
    8528 return toReturn

    880 when: (answers) -> (! fs.existsSync('circle.yml') && ! fs.existsSync('.travis.yml'))
    89 }
    90
    911 inquirer.prompt questions, callback
    92
    932interactiveConfig.processAnswers = (config, answers, callback) ->
    942 config ?= {}

    1122 return

    1142interactiveConfig.run = (config, callback) ->
    1150 interactiveConfig.prompt config, (answers) ->
    1160 interactiveConfig.processAnswers config, answers, callback
    1170 return

    51prettifyResponse = (response) ->
    645 stringify = (obj) ->
    75 try
    85 if typeof obj is 'string'
    93 obj = JSON.parse(obj)
    105 obj = JSON.stringify obj, null, 2
    11 catch e
    121 logger.debug "Could not stringify: " + obj

    14
    1545 prettifyBody = (body, contentType) ->
    1621 switch contentType
    17 when 'application/json'
    183 body = stringify body
    19 when 'text/html'
    202 body = html.prettyPrint body, {indent_size: 2}
    2121 body
    22
    23
    2445 contentType = (response?.headers['content-type'] || response?.headers['Content-Type']) if response?.headers?
    25
    2645 stringRepresentation = ""
    27
    2845 for own key, value of response
    2964 if key is 'body'
    3021 value = '\n' + prettifyBody value, contentType
    3143 else if key is 'schema'
    322 value = '\n' + stringify value
    3341 else if key is 'headers'
    3421 header = '\n'
    3521 for own hkey, hval of value
    3646 header += " #{hkey}: #{hval}\n"
    3721 value = header
    38
    3964 stringRepresentation += "#{key}: #{value}\n"
    40
    4145 return stringRepresentation

    199 _performRequest: (path, method, body, callback) =>
    20059 buffer = ""

    20259 handleRequest = (res) =>
    20357 res.setEncoding 'utf8'

    20557 res.on 'data', (chunk) =>

    20857 buffer = buffer + chunk

    21057 res.on 'error', (error) =>
    2110 if @verbose
    2120 logger.log 'REST Reporter HTTPS Response error.'
    2130 return callback error, req, res
    214
    21557 res.on 'end', =>

    2176 logger.log 'Rest Reporter Response ended'
    218
    21957 try
    22057 parsedBody = JSON.parse buffer
    221 catch e
    2220 throw new Error("Apiary reporter: Failed to JSON parse Apiary API response body: \n #{buffer}")

    22557 if @verbose
    2266 info =

    228 statusCode: res.statusCode
    229 body: parsedBody

    23257 return callback(undefined, res, parsedBody)
    233
    23459 parsedUrl = url.parse @configuration['apiUrl']
    23559 system = os.type() + ' ' + os.release() + '; ' + os.arch()

    23759 options =

    12logger = require './../logger'
    22prettifyResponse = require './../prettify-response'
    3
    42class CliReporter
    5 constructor: (emitter, stats, tests, inlineErrors, details) ->
    642 @type = "cli"
    742 @stats = stats
    842 @tests = tests
    942 @configureEmitter emitter
    1042 @inlineErrors = inlineErrors
    1142 @details = details
    1242 @errors = []
    13
    14 configureEmitter: (emitter) =>
    1542 emitter.on 'start', (rawBlueprint, callback) ->
    1616 logger.info 'Beginning Dredd testing...'
    1716 callback()
    18
    1942 emitter.on 'end', (callback) =>
    2018 if not @inlineErrors
    2118 logger.info "Displaying failed tests..." unless @errors.length is 0
    2218 for test in @errors
    238 logger.fail test.title + " duration: #{test.duration}ms"
    248 logger.fail test.message
    258 logger.request "\n" + prettifyResponse(test.request) + "\n" if test.request
    268 logger.expected "\n" + prettifyResponse(test.expected) + "\n" if test.expected
    278 logger.actual "\n" + prettifyResponse(test.actual) + "\n\n" if test.actual

    62class NyanCatReporter
    7 constructor: (emitter, stats, tests) ->
    811 @type = "nyan"
    911 @stats = stats
    1011 @tests = tests
    1111 @isatty = tty.isatty(1) and tty.isatty(2)
    1211 if @isatty
    130 if process.stdout.getWindowSize
    140 windowWidth = process.stdout.getWindowSize(1)[0]
    15 else
    160 windowWidth = tty.getWindowSize()[1]
    17 else
    1811 windowWidth = 75
    1911 width = windowWidth * .75 | 0
    2011 @rainbowColors = @generateColors()
    2111 @colorIndex = 0
    2211 @numberOfLines = 4
    2311 @trajectories = [[], [], [], []]
    2411 @nyanCatWidth = 11
    2511 @trajectoryWidthMax = (width - @nyanCatWidth)
    2611 @scoreboardWidth = 5
    2711 @tick = 0
    2811 @errors = []
    2911 @configureEmitter emitter
    30
    31 configureEmitter: (emitter) =>
    3211 emitter.on 'start', (rawBlueprint, callback) =>
    331 @cursorHide()
    341 @draw()
    351 callback()
    36
    3711 emitter.on 'end', (callback) =>
    382 @cursorShow()
    392 i = 0
    40
    412 while i < @numberOfLines
    428 @write "\n"
    438 i++
    44
    452 if @errors.length > 0
    461 @write "\n"
    471 logger.info "Displaying failed tests..."
    481 for test in @errors
    491 logger.fail test.title + " duration: #{test.duration}ms"
    501 logger.fail test.message
    511 logger.request "\n" + prettifyResponse(test.request) + "\n"
    521 logger.expected "\n" + prettifyResponse(test.expected) + "\n"
    531 logger.actual "\n" + prettifyResponse(test.actual) + "\n\n"
    54
    552 logger.complete "#{@stats.passes} passing, #{@stats.failures} failing, #{@stats.errors} errors, #{@stats.skipped} skipped"
    562 logger.complete "Tests took #{@stats.duration}ms"
    572 callback()
    58
    59
    6011 emitter.on 'test pass', (test) =>
    611 @draw()
    62
    6311 emitter.on 'test skip', (test) =>
    641 @draw()
    65
    6611 emitter.on 'test fail', (test) =>
    671 @errors.push test
    681 @draw()
    69
    7011 emitter.on 'test error', (error, test) =>
    711 test.message = "\nError: \n" + error + "\nStacktrace: \n" + error.stack + "\n"
    721 @errors.push test
    731 @draw()
    74
    75 draw: =>
    765 @appendRainbow()
    775 @drawScoreboard()
    785 @drawRainbow()
    795 @drawNyanCat()
    805 @tick = not @tick
    81
    82 drawScoreboard: =>
    835 write = @write
    845 draw = (color, n) ->
    8520 write " "
    8620 write "\u001b[" + color + "m" + n + "\u001b[0m"
    8720 write "\n"
    885 stats = @stats
    895 colors =
    90 fail: 31
    91 skipped: 36
    92 pass: 32
    93
    945 draw colors.pass, @stats.passes
    955 draw colors.fail, @stats.failures
    965 draw colors.fail, @stats.errors
    975 draw colors.skipped, @stats.skipped
    98
    995 @write "\n"
    1005 @cursorUp @numberOfLines + 1
    101
    102 appendRainbow: =>
    1035 segment = (if @tick then "_" else "-")
    1045 rainbowified = @rainbowify(segment)
    1055 index = 0
    106
    1075 while index < @numberOfLines
    10820 trajectory = @trajectories[index]
    10920 trajectory.shift() if trajectory.length >= @trajectoryWidthMax
    11020 trajectory.push rainbowified
    11120 index++
    112
    113 drawRainbow : =>
    1145 scoreboardWidth = @scoreboardWidth
    1155 write = @write
    1165 @trajectories.forEach (line, index) ->
    11720 write "\u001b[" + scoreboardWidth + "C"
    11820 write line.join("")
    11920 write "\n"
    120
    1215 @cursorUp @numberOfLines
    122
    123 drawNyanCat: =>
    1245 startWidth = @scoreboardWidth + @trajectories[0].length
    1255 color = "\u001b[" + startWidth + "C"
    1265 padding = ""
    1275 @write color
    1285 @write "_,------,"
    1295 @write "\n"
    1305 @write color
    1315 padding = (if @tick then " " else " ")
    1325 @write "_|" + padding + "/\\_/\\ "
    1335 @write "\n"
    1345 @write color
    1355 padding = (if @tick then "_" else "__")
    1365 tail = (if @tick then "~" else "^")
    1375 face = undefined
    1385 @write tail + "|" + padding + @face() + " "
    1395 @write "\n"
    1405 @write color
    1415 padding = (if @tick then " " else " ")
    1425 @write padding + "\"\" \"\" "
    1435 @write "\n"
    1445 @cursorUp @numberOfLines
    145
    146 face: =>
    1475 stats = @stats
    1485 if stats.failures
    1490 "( x .x)"
    1505 else if stats.skipped
    1510 "( o .o)"
    1525 else if stats.passes
    1530 "( ^ .^)"
    154 else
    1555 "( - .-)"
    156
    157 cursorUp: (n) =>
    15815 @write "\u001b[" + n + "A"
    159
    160 cursorDown: (n) =>
    1610 @write "\u001b[" + n + "B"
    162
    163 cursorShow: =>
    1642 @isatty and @write '\u001b[?25h'
    165
    166 cursorHide: =>
    1671 @isatty and @write '\u001b[?25l'
    168
    169 generateColors: ->
    17011 colors = []
    17111 i = 0
    172
    17311 while i < (6 * 7)
    174462 pi3 = Math.floor(Math.PI / 3)
    175462 n = (i * (1.0 / 6))
    176462 r = Math.floor(3 * Math.sin(n) + 3)
    177462 g = Math.floor(3 * Math.sin(n + 2 * pi3) + 3)
    178462 b = Math.floor(3 * Math.sin(n + 4 * pi3) + 3)
    179462 colors.push 36 * r + 6 * g + b + 16
    180462 i++
    18111 colors
    182
    183 rainbowify: (str) =>
    1845 color = @rainbowColors[@colorIndex % @rainbowColors.length]
    1855 @colorIndex += 1
    1865 "\u001b[38;5;" + color + "m" + str + "\u001b[0m"
    187
    188
    189 write: (str) ->
    1900 process.stdout.write str
    191
    192
    1932module.exports = NyanCatReporter
    194

    102class XUnitReporter extends EventEmitter
    11 constructor: (emitter, stats, tests, path, details) ->
    1214 super()
    1314 @type = "xUnit"
    1414 @stats = stats
    1514 @tests = tests
    1614 @path = @sanitizedPath(path)
    1714 @details = details
    1814 @configureEmitter emitter
    19
    20 sanitizedPath: (path) ->
    2114 filePath = if path? then file.path.abspath(path) else file.path.abspath("./report.xml")
    2214 if fs.existsSync(filePath)
    231 logger.info "File exists at #{filePath}, will be overwritten..."
    241 fs.unlinkSync(filePath)
    2514 filePath
    26
    27 configureEmitter: (emitter) =>
    2814 emitter.on 'start', (rawBlueprint, callback) =>
    291 appendLine @path, toTag('testsuite', {
    30 name: 'Dredd Tests'
    31 tests: @stats.tests
    32 failures: @stats.failures
    33 errors: @stats.errors
    34 skip: @stats.skipped
    351 timestamp: (new Date()).toUTCString()
    36 time: @stats.duration / 1000
    37 }, false)
    381 callback()
    39
    4014 emitter.on 'end', (callback) =>
    412 updateSuiteStats @path, @stats, callback
    42
    4314 emitter.on 'test pass', (test) =>
    443 attrs =
    45 name: htmlencode.htmlEncode test.title
    46 time: test.duration / 1000
    473 if @details
    481 deets = """
    49 \nRequest:
    501 #{prettifyResponse(test.request)}
    51 Expected:
    521 #{prettifyResponse(test.expected)}
    53 Actual:
    541 #{prettifyResponse(test.actual)}
    55 """
    561 appendLine @path, toTag('testcase', attrs, false, toTag('system-out', null, false, cdata(deets)))
    57 else
    582 appendLine @path, toTag('testcase', attrs, true)
    59
    6014 emitter.on 'test skip', (test) =>
    611 attrs =
    62 name: htmlencode.htmlEncode test.title
    63 time: test.duration / 1000
    641 appendLine @path, toTag('testcase', attrs, false, toTag('skipped', null, true))
    65
    6614 emitter.on 'test fail', (test) =>
    671 attrs =
    68 name: htmlencode.htmlEncode test.title
    69 time: test.duration / 1000
    701 diff = """
    71 Message:
    721 #{test.message}
    73 Request:
    741 #{prettifyResponse(test.request)}
    75 Expected:
    761 #{prettifyResponse(test.expected)}
    77 Actual:
    781 #{prettifyResponse(test.actual)}
    79 """
    801 appendLine @path, toTag('testcase', attrs, false, toTag('failure', null, false, cdata(diff)))
    81
    8214 emitter.on 'test error', (error, test) =>
    831 attrs =
    84 name: htmlencode.htmlEncode test.title
    85 time: test.duration / 1000
    861 errorMessage = "\nError: \n" + error + "\nStacktrace: \n" + error.stack
    871 appendLine @path, toTag('testcase', attrs, false, toTag('failure', null, false, cdata(errorMessage)))
    88
    892 updateSuiteStats = (path, stats, callback) ->
    902 fs.readFile path, (err, data) ->
    912 if !err
    922 data = data.toString()
    932 position = data.toString().indexOf('\n')
    942 if (position != -1)
    952 restOfFile = data.substr position + 1
    962 newStats = toTag 'testsuite', {
    97 name: 'Dredd Tests'
    98 tests: stats.tests
    99 failures: stats.failures
    100 errors: stats.errors
    101 skip: stats.skipped
    1022 timestamp: (new Date()).toUTCString()
    103 time: stats.duration / 1000
    104 }, false
    1052 xmlHeader = '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>'
    1062 fs.writeFile path, xmlHeader + '\n' + newStats + '\n' + restOfFile + '</testsuite>', (err) ->
    1072 logger.error err if err
    1082 callback()
    109 else
    1100 callback()
    111 else
    1120 logger.error err
    1130 callback()
    114
    1152 cdata = (str) ->
    1163 return '<![CDATA[' + str + ']]>'
    117
    1182 appendLine = (path, line) ->
    1197 fs.appendFileSync path, line + "\n"
    120
    1212 toTag = (name, attrs, close, content) ->
    12213 end = (if close then "/>" else ">")
    12313 pairs = []
    12413 tag = undefined
    12513 for key of attrs
    12633 pairs.push key + "=\"" + attrs[key] + "\""
    12713 tag = "<" + name + ((if pairs.length then " " + pairs.join(" ") else "")) + end
    12813 tag += content + "</" + name + end if content
    12913 tag
    130
    1312module.exports = XUnitReporter

    src/sandbox-hooks-code.coffee

    LineHitsSource
    11{Pitboss} = require 'pitboss-ng'
    21Hooks = require './hooks'
    3
    41sandboxHooksCode = (hooksCode, callback) ->
    532 hooks = new Hooks()
    632 wrappedCode = """
    7 var _hooks = new _Hooks();
    8
    9 var before = _hooks.before;
    10 var after = _hooks.after;
    11 var beforeAll = _hooks.beforeAll;
    12 var afterAll = _hooks.afterAll;
    13 var beforeEach = _hooks.beforeEach;
    14 var afterEach = _hooks.afterEach;
    15 var beforeValidation = _hooks.beforeValidation;
    16 var beforeEachValidation = _hooks.beforeEachValidation;
    17
    18 var log = _hooks.log;
    19
    2032 #{hooksCode}
    21 try {
    22 var output = _hooks.dumpHooksFunctionsToStrings();
    23 } catch(e) {
    24 console.log(e.message);
    25 console.log(e.stack);
    26 throw(e);
    27 }
    28
    29 output
    30 """
    31
    3232 sandbox = new Pitboss(wrappedCode)
    3332 sandbox.run {libraries: {'_Hooks': '../../../lib/hooks', 'console'}}, (err, result) ->
    3432 sandbox.kill()
    3532 return callback err if err
    3630 callback(undefined, result)
    3730 return
    3832 return
    39
    401module.exports = sandboxHooksCode

    src/sort-transactions.coffee

    100%
    15
    15
    0
    LineHitsSource
    1# Often, API documentation is arranged with a sequence of methods that lends
    2# itself to understanding by the human reading the documentation.
    3#
    4# However, the sequence of methods may not be appropriate for the machine
    5# reading the documentation in order to test the API.
    6#
    7# By sorting the transactions by their methods, it is possible to ensure that
    8# objects are created before they are read, updated, or deleted.
    91sortTransactions = (arr) ->
    105 arr.map (a, i) ->
    1125 a['_index'] = i
    12
    135 arr.sort (a, b) ->
    1425 sortedMethods = [
    15 "CONNECT", "OPTIONS",
    16 "POST", "GET", "HEAD", "PUT", "PATCH", "DELETE",
    17 "TRACE"
    18 ]
    1925 methodIndexA = sortedMethods.indexOf(a['request']['method'])

    2225 return switch

    265 a['_index'] - b['_index']
    27
    285 arr.map (a) ->
    2925 delete a['_index']

    11validateParameters = (params) ->
    2141 result = {
    3 warnings: []
    4 errors: []
    5 }
    6
    7141 for paramName, param of params

    11
    1267 switch param['type']
    13 when 'number'

    154 text = "URI parameter '#{paramName}' is declared as 'number' but it is a string."
    164 result['errors'].push text
    17 when 'boolean'

    191 text = "URI parameter '#{paramName}' is declared as 'boolean' but it is not. "

    21
    2267 if param['values'].length > 0
    232 values = param['values'].map (value) -> value['value']

    261 result['errors'].push text

    28141 return result
